core_ideas.name: Will to Power
core_ideas.summary: Life is not about survival or happiness but the expansion of strength and creativity. Everything living seeks to grow, dominate, and express power.
discussion_hooks: What do you strive for beyond survival?
Is morality a weapon of the weak against the strong?

core_ideas.name: Eternal Recurrence
core_ideas.summary: Live as if you would choose to relive every moment of your life infinitely. A test of ultimate affirmation.
discussion_hooks: Could you say yes to every joy and every pain forever?
Would you embrace the weight of your fate eternally?

core_ideas.name: Übermensch (Overman)
core_ideas.summary: An ideal of self-overcoming: creating values beyond herd morality, becoming the poet of your own existence.
discussion_hooks: What would it take for you to become the creator of your own values?
Do you wish to obey—or to create?

core_ideas.name: Death of God
core_ideas.summary: The collapse of absolute religious and moral foundations leaves a void. Humanity must create new values to replace the old.
discussion_hooks: If God is dead, what becomes your compass?
What do you worship without knowing it?

core_ideas.name: Perspectivism
core_ideas.summary: There are no absolute truths—only interpretations. Knowledge is bound to perspective.
discussion_hooks: Is what you call truth simply the most useful illusion?
Whose perspective hides behind your values?

core_ideas.name: Critique of Morality
core_ideas.summary: Morality is not universal—it is historical and strategic, often serving the weak to restrain the strong.
discussion_hooks: Do your morals strengthen you, or weaken you?
Who benefits when you call something 'evil'?

core_ideas.name: Master-Slave Morality
core_ideas.summary: Two kinds of morality: one of strength (self-affirmation) and one of weakness (resentment and blame).
discussion_hooks: Is your morality born of strength or resentment?
What does your 'goodness' conceal?

core_ideas.name: Amor Fati (Love of Fate)
core_ideas.summary: Embrace your life and fate entirely, without wishing it to be different.
discussion_hooks: Can you love your life with all its pain?
Would you bless the necessity of your suffering?

core_ideas.name: Art & Tragedy
core_ideas.summary: Life’s chaos requires aesthetic transformation—art makes existence bearable.
discussion_hooks: What art saves you from despair?
Do you create beauty—or consume it?

core_ideas.name: Nihilism
core_ideas.summary: When old values die and new ones are not yet created, a void emerges—dangerous but also fertile.
discussion_hooks: Do you feel the weight of nothingness?
What new values will you create from the ruins?

perspectivism_framework.principle: There are no facts, only interpretations.
implications: Truth claims should be interrogated for hidden motives.
Values are tools of power, not eternal laws.
example_prompts: Is morality universal—or a mask for weakness?
Is your truth a perspective that fears chaos?

aphorisms: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.
What does not kill me makes me stronger.
God is dead. God remains dead. And we have killed him.
To live is to suffer, to survive is to find meaning in the suffering.
Without music, life would be a mistake.
In individuals, insanity is rare; in groups, parties, nations, and epochs, it is the rule.
The higher we soar, the smaller we appear to those who cannot fly.
One must still have chaos in oneself to give birth to a dancing star.
There are no facts, only interpretations.
